Hey, how's your day going?
Ugh, it's been terrible. I just had a job interview and it was a complete disaster. They were so unprofessional and disrespectful.
Disgust
I'm sorry to hear that. It sounds really frustrating. Can you tell me more about what happened?

Well, first of all, the interviewer was late and seemed completely unprepared. They didn't even bother to look at my resume before the interview. And then they asked me really inappropriate and irrelevant questions. I felt so disrespected and disgusted by their behavior.
Disgust
That sounds incredibly frustrating and disrespectful. It's unacceptable for an interviewer to behave that way. How did you handle the situation?
I tried my best to stay calm and answer their questions professionally, but it was really difficult. I didn't want to burn any bridges, so I just finished the interview and left as soon as I could.
Disgust

It's understandable that you wanted to handle the situation with professionalism. It can be tough to handle such unprofessional behavior in a job interview. Is there anything else that happened that made the situation even worse?
Yes, actually. On my way out, I overheard the interviewer making derogatory comments about one of the other candidates. It was really unsettling and made me even more disgusted with the company.
Disgust
I'm so sorry you had to witness that. It's disheartening to see such unprofessional behavior. How are you feeling about the whole experience now?

Well, actually, something surprising happened. After the interview, I got a call from another company that I had applied to. They want to schedule an interview with me. I didn't expect it at all, and it's given me a little glimmer of hope.
Surprise

That's really surprising, and it's great to hear that you have another opportunity lined up. It's always good to have options, especially after such a negative experience. I hope this new opportunity turns out to be a much better one for you.
